info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Berkshire, northern Dutchess and southeastern Columbia Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Red Hook, or near Rhinebeck, moving northeast at 35 mph. Storm is showing some low level rotation with it. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rhinebeck, Copake, Sheffield, Pine Plains, Red Hook, Ancram, Ashley Falls, Bethel, Milan, Hillsdale, Pachin Mills, Ancramdale, Kerleys Corners, Linden Acres, Alander, Fraleighs, Taconic, Silvernails, Jackson Corners and Eighmyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Connecticut...and east central New York.
